column4: I am using network-manager-pptp 0.6.5. I have put in a username and password which are saved, and so I don't get prompted. trouble is, the password has changed, but I can't work out how to get network-manager to prompt me for it again, not can I find a file in which it is stored. how can I enter the new password?
system -> prefernces -> keyring,  i think
I don't see anything about my pptp logins in there
encryption and keyrings, that is.
the keyring should have all your stored passwords
of course. but how do I change one or delete one?
right click and hit delete
on what, exactly?
I have run system->preferences->encryption and keyrings. there are five tabs: password keyrings, encryption, pgp passphrases, key servers, key sharing
hit passwords, find the one you want to delete, right click it, and delete
there is nothing called passwords
what program are you running, and which package is it in?
oh sorry, should be applications -> accessories -> passwords and encryption keys
thanks very much! got it!
I feel like a little bit of a dunce now... that was pretty easy! ;-)
isnt the deceptively simple always fun?
what's the difference between that and $PS1?
PS1?
the "old way"
for PROMPT_COMMAND? no idea. i just looked through bashrc til i found the line that does the prompt
otherwise known as hiragana ;-)
not trying to get technical
